main event: On March 3, 1956, a bright red, round object, approximately 40-50 feet in diameter, was observed in Paradise, Michigan. The object appeared to be floating up and down below the horizon for about 10-15 minutes.
interesting points: The observation was of a single object, which was described as bright red and floating below the horizon.
Winds from the northwest at high velocity were noted during the sighting.
The conclusion in the report suggests that the object was probably a balloon due to the high-velocity winds.
The report mentions that there were photographs taken during the observation.
The sighting was categorized as a ground-visual observation, indicating that it was observed from the ground without any associated radar or aerial interception.
sighted object: bright red, round object, approximately 40-50 feet in diameter
witnesses: Military personnel from the 659th ACW Squadron at Calumet AFS, Michigan
